<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sys_hub_flow"> <sys_hub_flow action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <access>public</access> <acls/> <active>true</active> <annotation/> <callable_by_client_api>false</callable_by_client_api> <category display_value="Password Management">3993397293f70300eb08925cf67ffb95</category> <copied_from>e1c4bb87730473005ae12ea3c4f6a7ce</copied_from> <copied_from_name>Password Change Copy</copied_from_name> <description><html></html><p>Change a Microsoft AD user’s password</p> <p><b>Inputs:</b> </p><ul><li><b>Password Reset Request</b> - Password request record.</li><li><b>Current Password</b> - The current password of the user.</li><li><b>New Password</b> - The new password the user wants to set.</li></ul>
<p><b>Outputs:</b> </p><ul><li><b>Status</b> - Will be set to &#39;Success&#39; if the request succeeds or &#39;Error&#39; if a failure occurs.</li><li><b>Error Message</b> - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.</li></ul>
<p><b>Error Messages:</b> </p><ul><li>Invalid User Name</li><li>Invalid Request</li><li>Invalid Credentials for host</li><li>The Old Password is incorrect</li><li>The referenced account is currently locked out and may not be logged on to</li><li>The New Password does not meet the password policy requirements. Check the minimum password length, password complexity and password history requirements</li><li>Invalid hostname in connection or Host not reachable from Mid server</li><li>Host Credentials incorrect. Authentication Error in MID Server</li><li>Unknown Error. Please check error log for more information</li><li>The request has no process associated with it.</li><li>The user associated with request is not valid.</li><li>The process associated with request is not valid.</li><li>There are more than one credential stores defined for process.</li><li>The credential store associated with request is not valid.</li></ul>
</description> <internal_name>password_change</internal_name> <copied_from_name/> <description><html></html><p>Change a Microsoft AD user’s password</p> <p><b>Inputs:</b> </p><ul><li><b>Password Reset Request</b> - Password request record.</li><li><b>Current Password</b> - The current password of the user.</li><li><b>New Password</b> - The new password the user wants to set.</li></ul>
<p><b>Outputs:</b> </p><ul><li><b>Status</b> - Will be set to &#39;Success&#39; if the request succeeds or &#39;Error&#39; if a failure occurs.</li><li><b>Error Message</b> - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.</li></ul>
<p><b>Error Messages:</b> </p><ul><li>Invalid User Name</li><li>Invalid Request</li><li>Invalid Credentials for host</li><li>The Old Password is incorrect</li><li>The referenced account is currently locked out and may not be logged on to</li><li>The New Password does not meet the password policy requirements. Check the minimum password length, password complexity and password history requirements</li><li>Invalid hostname in connection or Host not reachable from Mid server</li><li>Host Credentials incorrect. Authentication Error in MID Server</li><li>Unknown Error. Please check error log for more information</li><li>The request has no process associated with it.</li><li>The user associated with request is not valid.</li><li>The process associated with request is not valid.</li><li>There are more than one credential stores defined for process.</li><li>The credential store associated with request is not valid.</li></ul>
